file.title: Review
file.bullet: What does connection.prepareStatement(sql) do?
Create the prepared statement object, when used with INSERT, Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS can be added.
What does statement.setXXX(idx, value) do?
XXX is the type of the value, and idx is the number of the placeholder -- Bind a value to the statement.
What does statement.executeQuery() do?
Execute the prepared SELECT query.
What does statement.executeUpdate() do?
Execute an INSERT or UPDATE query.
What does statement.getResultSet do?
Get the results of a SELECT query.
What does statement.getGeneratedKeys do?
Get the generated ids from an INSERT query
What is XSS?
A Cross Site Scripting, or XSS, attack is one in which malicious JavaScript is inflicted on your users.
When do they occur?
This type of vulnerability can occur if we carelessly display user input on our pages.
How can we protect against these attacks?
We can use the JSTL library's c:out tag for this.
What might an experienced hacker try to do with an XSS attack?
A dedicated, determined, and malicious individual could write some JavaScript to steal usernames and passwords, or hijacking sessions.
